text: Euonymus acanthocarpusEuonymus acanthocarpus. Flora of China. is a species of flowering plant in the family Celastraceae. It is endemic to China. It has a scattered distribution in forest habitat.Sun, W. 1998. Euonymus acanthocarpa. In: IUCN 2013. IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2013.1. Downloaded on 04 July 2013. This species is a shrub which can reach 8 meters tall, but is usually not more than 2 or 3. It has leathery leaves and inflorescences of many flowers. The flower is yellow-green and 6 to 8 millimeters wide. The fruit capsule is covered in prickles and contains seeds with orange arils. ==Sources== acanthocarpus Category:Endemic flora of China Category:Near threatened plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Euonymus acanthocarpus
